title: Trace: Unexpected Indentation
story: Python uses indentation to define code blocks. IndentationError occurs when the indentation is inconsistent or unexpected.
instructions: Read the error message and locate the indentation problem in the code.

hints.text: IndentationError means Python found unexpected indentation or inconsistent spacing.
Look for mixing tabs and spaces, or incorrect indentation levels.

traceReading.stackTrace:
File "main.py", line 3
    print(x)
    ^
IndentationError: unexpected indent

questions.question: What type of error is this?
On which line is the indentation problem?
How would you fix the indentation in this function?
questions.correctAnswer: Indent line 2 (print('Hello')) to be inside the function body
